title: 106_s1026
content: The Medicare HMO Protection Act of 1999 allows for the evaluation and alteration of termination decisions. The Medicare HMO Protection Act of 1999 allows the Secretary to delay termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if it poses a serious health risk to enrollees. The Medicare HMO Protection Act of 1999 allows the Secretary to delay termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if the organization offers plans in nearby areas without significant financial losses. The Secretary may audit the organization's books to make this determination. The Secretary has the authority to delay termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if an adequate provider network is established to provide equal insurance coverage. The Secretary may also renegotiate the contract if needed. The Secretary can delay termination of a Medicare+Choice plan to negotiate a new contract that ensures beneficiaries are not negatively impacted. SEC. 3. Extension of initial Medicare+Choice contract period to 3 years. Amends the Social Security Act to require contracts to have a minimum term of 3 years. Effective for contracts entered into after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Notice of termination. Amendment to Section 1857(d)(3) of the Social Security Act requires organizations to provide written notice 120 days before contract termination to enrolled individuals, including descriptions of alternative Medicare+Choice plans and supplemental policies available. The amendment to Section 1857(d)(3) of the Social Security Act mandates organizations to give 120 days written notice before terminating a contract, including details on alternative Medicare+Choice plans, supplemental policies, and local social service agencies for assistance. Effective for termination notices provided after the enactment of this Act.
